visible_angle_info¶

list of numpy.array – The angle functions for each edge in each closed polygonal boundary

compute_visible_angle_info(pls, visible_vx_set_for_edges, resolution)[source]¶
Compute the visible angle info for the input polygon
For each visible vertex, we need to calculate:
  1. the view angle at the current vertex w.r.t the current edge and
  2. the view angle at the sample points on the edge and the next vertex w.r.t the current edge
  3. insert a np.nan for discontinuity otherwise matplotlib will try to connect them together
Parameters:
  • pls (Partial_Local_Sequence) –
  • resolution (int) – the number of sample points on each edge
Returns:

The visible angle info for the input polygon
Return type:

np.array
visualize(hline=None)[source]¶

  • hline (float) – The angle of fix theta bouncing

maps¶

orthogonal_env¶

partial_local_sequence¶

class Partial_Local_Sequence(polygon)[source]¶

Bases: object

Partial local sequence is a sequence of points on the boundary of P associated with a vertex v0, and is constructed by shooting a ray through a reflex vertex v0 from every visible vertex and keeping the resulting sequence of intersections with the boundary of P. The partial local sequence for a convex vertex is empty.

polygon¶

numpy.array – The polygon that the partial local sequence is built upon

inserted_polygon¶

numpy.array – The polygon with all new vertices inserted

sequence_info¶

list – A 2D array stores the partial local sequence for each vertex in polygon in rows

compute_sequence(input_polygon)[source]¶

Compute the partial local sequence for all vertices of the polygon

compute_inserted_polygon(polygon, sequence_info)[source]¶

Compute the polygon with all new vertices from the partial local sequence inserted

settings¶

Settings (constant values, file paths, etc) for the project

simple_polygon¶

class Simple_Polygon(name, outer_boundary_vertices, holes=[])[source]¶

Bases: object

Partial local sequence is a sequence of points on the boundary of P associated with a vertex v0, and is constructed by shooting a ray through a reflex vertex v0 from every visible vertex and keeping the resulting sequence of intersections with the boundary of P. The partial local sequence for a convex vertex is empty.

name¶

str – name of the environment; used for saving results

outer_boundary_vertices¶

numpy.array – A list of coordinates of vertices in outer most boundary of the polygon in counter clockwise order.

holes¶

list of numpy.array – A list of list of coordinates, each list contains vertices in a hole in the polygon in clockwise order

complete_vertex_list¶

list of (int, np.array) – Assigned each vertex an index and store the the index and coordinates in a list. The tuples are stored according to the index increasing order

vertex_list_per_poly¶

list of list of np.array – Store the vertex list for each close boundary in the polygon into a list

size¶

int – the total number of vertices in the polygon

reflex_vertices¶

list of numpy.array – list of reflex vertices in the polygon using the index assigned in complete_vertex_list

unit_interval_mapping¶

(list of floats, list of list of floats) – see compute_unit_interval_mapping

compute_unit_interval_mapping()[source]¶

Map the vertices of the polygon on to a given interval (length specified in settings) where both the start and the end of the interval identify with the first vertex in the polygon

reflex_verts_single_boundary(vs)[source]¶

return indices of all reflex vertices in poly
